intro: Hieracium subramosum var. lonchotum, commonly known as the long-stemmed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, branched stems covered in fine hairs. Its basal leaves are lance-shaped and often have a reddish or purplish hue, while the upper leaves are narrower and more elongated. It thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as meadows and woodland edges.
